column2:
noun
  1. (Kirchröadsj) nature, character, disposition
  2. (Kirchröadsj) behavior
  3. (Kirchröadsj) way, method
  4. (Kirchröadsj, biology, taxonomy) species

noun
  1. (Kirchröadsj) memory; remembrance (especially of a deceased person)
  2. (Kirchröadsj) memento; souvenir; keepsake (something of emotional value kept as a reminder)

noun
  1. (western Moselle Franconian, few dialects of Ripuarian, Limburgan Ripuarian) ape; monkey

noun
  1. (westernmost Ripuarian) An abbot, monastic superior of an abbey

noun
  1. (Kirchröadsj, Roman Catholicism) indulgence, reduction of expected punishment in purgatory

noun
  1. (eastern Moselle Franconian, also Moselle Franconian / Hunsrückisch) ape; monkey

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, some dialects of Moselle Franconian) apple pie

noun
  1. (Kirchröadsj, informal) testicle, nut
  2. (Kirchröadsj, sports) pass, shot
  3. (Kirchröadsj, chiefly in the negative) anything
  4. (Kirchröadsj) A bale of hay or straw.
  5. (Kirchröadsj) A closed bag or package of wares.

noun
  1. (most dialects) ball (round or roundish object, most commonly used in games)
  2. (most dialects, dance) ball (social gathering for dancing), prom (US)

noun
  1. (Moselle Franconian) berry (kind of fruit)
  2. (Moselle Franconian) bear (animal)
  3. (parts of western Moselle Franconian) beer

noun
  1. (many dialects) beer (drink)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) book

name
  1. (Kölsch) Bremen (the capital city of the state of Bremen, Germany)
  2. (Kölsch) Bremen (a state of Germany)

noun
  1. (most of Ripuarian) bride (woman on or with regard to her wedding day)

noun
  1. (southern Moselle Franconian) bread
  2. (same region) loaf of bread

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) bread
  2. (same regions) loaf of bread

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) belly; abdomen; stomach

noun
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) pouch; bag; purse; wallet
  2. (same dialects) scrotum

noun

  2. (same dialects) scrotum

noun

name

noun

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) a young boy, especially a naughty one (but always in a mild tone)

noun
  1. (most of Ripuarian, parts of Moselle Franconian) window

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) foot (lower part of the leg)

noun

noun
  1. (most dialects) question

noun

noun
  1. (southern Moselle Franconian) foot (lower part of the leg)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) heel (back of the foot or shoe)

noun
  1. (chiefly Kölsch) a cheese sandwich, cut in half

noun

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) starveling

noun

noun
  1. boy, lad
  2. son
  3. bachelor, unmarried man of any age

noun
  1. (most of Moselle Franconian, parts of Ripuarian) child

noun
  1. (Moselle Franconian / Hunsrückisch) fellow, guy, chap, bloke, man

noun

noun

noun

  3. (most dialects) ball, lump, clot (solidified piece of a soft material)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) cow (female bovine animal)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, uncountable) rye

noun

noun

noun
  1. A nickname for Jakob

noun
  1. (most dialects) Kölsch lect

noun

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) song

noun
  1. (central and eastern Ripuarian, western Moselle Franconian) ladder

noun
  1. (Moselle Franconian) rope of minor to medium thickness; cord

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) rope of minor to medium thickness; cord

noun
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) corpse (dead human body)

noun
  1. (Kölsch) rope of minor to medium thickness; cord

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) air (gas)
  2. (Ripuarian, some dialects) air (the apparently open space above the ground of the earth)

noun
  1. (most dialects, but dated in parts of Ripuarian) spoon

noun
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) people; persons; folk

noun
  1. (all of Moselle Franconian) a thin-bodied flying insect, particularly a mosquito, also a crane fly, gnat, or midge

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, some dialects of Moselle Franconian) knife

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) mouth of a person
  2. (Ripuarian) mouth of an animal; snout; muzzle
  3. (western Ripuarian) slipper

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) a thin-bodied flying insect, particularly a mosquito, also a crane fly, gnat, or midge

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) an older woman; not implying decrepitness, but having a mildly contemptuous tone

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) ox (castrated male bovine animal)
  2. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) bull (any male bovine animal)

noun
  1. (central and eastern Ripuarian, parts of Moselle Franconian) oil

noun
  1. (most of Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) eye

name
  1. (Moselle Franconian, central and eastern Ripuarian) Aachen (city)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, now chiefly western dialects) pledge; security; deposit; pawn
  2. (Ripuarian, dated) delimited area or surface (chiefly of land, hence: parcel)

noun
  1. (most dialects) pastor (clergyman who serves a parish)

noun
  1. (Moselle Franconian) stovepipe
  2. (Moselle Franconian) pipe (smoking implement)
  3. (Moselle Franconian) flute

noun
  1. plan (way of procedure)

noun

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) plum; usually restricted to the round, firm sorts; sometimes including longer, softer sorts
  2. (Ripuarian, mildly vulgar) pussy; vulva

noun
  1. (western and central Ripuarian) pullet; young hen
  2. (the same dialects, mildly vulgar) young, usually attractive girl; chick

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) stillness, calm, rest, ease, tranquility, silence (absence of stress, movement, and/or sound)

noun
  1. (most of Moselle Franconian, parts of Ripuarian) cow; bull; (head of) cattle

name
  1. (some of Ripuarian, including Kölsch) Rhine (European river)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, western Moselle Franconian) sow; female pig
  2. (eastern Moselle Franconian) pig (male or female)

noun
  1. (Moselle Franconian) disc, slice, pane (flat piece or surface)

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) disc, slice, pane (flat piece or surface)

noun
  1. (western Moselle Franconian) pig; swine (animal)
  2. (all dialects) swine (mean person)

noun
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) side
  2. (most dialects of Ripuarian) page

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, western Moselle Franconian) rope of medium to maximal thickness

noun
  1. (most dialects) sense
  2. (most dialects) mind
  3. (Moselle Franconian) sin

noun
  1. (most dialects) stick; staff

noun
  1. (some of Ripuarian, including Kölsch) tail (of an animal)

noun
  1. (most of Ripuarian) star

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, plural Stöcker) piece

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) ear
  2. (Ripuarian) watch; clock
  3. (Ripuarian) o'clock

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, many dialects of Moselle Franconian) bird

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) a frog kept in a jar with a small ladder, used to predict the weather; see German Wetterfrosch for more

noun
  1. (Ripuarian) a child, especially a girl, daughter
  2. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) cradle

noun
  1. (northernmost Ripuarian) girl (female child, adolescent, young woman)

noun
  1. (most of Moselle Franconian, parts of Ripuarian) winter

noun
  1. (Ripuarian, few dialects of Moselle Franconian) widow

noun
  1. (southern and eastern Moselle Franconian) scales (instrument for measuring)

  1. (Ripuarian, north-western Moselle Franconian) scales (instrument for measuring)

noun

noun
  1. (Limburgan Ripuarian) seed, grain
  2. (Limburgan Ripuarian, uncommon) sperm, semen

noun
  1. (chiefly Ripuarian) kind; sort
  2. (in particular) a certain kind of people, of characters

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive) to burn to the pan.
  2. (Kirchröadsj, ergative) to cook evenly.

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, ditransitive) to offer, to provide.
  2. (Kirchröadsj, reflexive) to offer oneself, to volunteer, (in sexual contexts) to solicit.

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to recommend
  2. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to advocate
  3. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive, reflexive) to recommend oneself

verb

verb

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive) to make contact, to reach out

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to bark at
  2. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to shout at (in an unsympathetic manner)

  1. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to tap into a resource (mostly said of coal)

adv

adj

  2. (some dialects of Ripuarian) different

verb

  2. (same regions, reflexive) to be bent

prep
  1. (most dialects) at; with; by; near; (close) to

adj
  1. (Moselle Franconian, some dialects of Ripuarian) blind; unable to see

adj
  1. (chiefly Ripuarian) bare; naked; uncovered; said of body parts, not of people

verb
  1. (most dialects) to bring; to take something somewhere

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to need
  2. (Ripuarian, interrogative or negated) to need, have to

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, reflexive) to bend down, to stoop

article
  1. (most dialects) feminine nominative and accusative
  2. (most dialects) plural nominative and accusative

  4. (some dialects) masculine nominative
  5. (some dialects) masculine accusative
  6. (few dialects) feminine dative

verb

  3. (same dialects) Used in the subjunctive with a following infinitive to form the conditional tense.

adv

verb
  1. (few dialects of Moselle Franconian) to carry, bear, wear

verb
  1. (most of Ripuarian) to carry, bear, wear

verb
  1. (central and western Ripuarian) to turn, spin, twist

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, transitive) to drive; to push; to chase (cause to go somewhere or to do something)
  2. (Ripuarian, intransitive) to float

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, mildly vulgar) to shit; to defecate

verb
  1. (most of Moselle Franconian, parts of southern Ripuarian) to carry, bear, wear

adj
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) dead; not alive

article
  1. (Ripuarian) masculine nominative and accusative
  2. (Ripuarian) feminine dative
  3. (some dialects of Ripuarian) plural dative

article
  1. (many dialects) plural dative

  3. (western Moselle Franconian) masculine nominative

article
  1. (Moselle Franconian) feminine dative
  2. (eastern Moselle Franconian) masculine nominative

  1. (Moselle Franconian) around

prep

adv

conj

adj

column2:
verb
  1. (westernmost Ripuarian and Kölsch, auxiliary, with a past participle) to have (forms the perfect and past perfect tense)
  2. (same dialects, transitive) to have; to own (to possess, have ownership of; to possess a certain characteristic)
  3. (same dialects, transitive) to have; to hold (to contain within itself/oneself)
  4. (same dialects, transitive) to have, get (to obtain, acquire)
  5. (same dialects, transitive) to get (to receive)
  6. (same dialects, transitive) to have (to be afflicted with, suffer from)
  7. (same dialects, transitive, of units of measure) to contain, be composed of, equal
  8. (same dialects, impersonal, with het or 't) there be, there is, there are
  9. (same dialects, with 't and mit) to be occupied with, to like, to be into
  10. (same dialects, with 't and uvver) to talk about

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, some dialects of Moselle Franconian) to hit, beat
  2. (westernmost Ripuarian) to hold, keep

adv
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) here; in this place

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, dated in some dialects) to help

pron
  1. (most dialects) he; nominative of the third-person singular masculine

adj
  1. (Ripuarian, chiefly predicative and adverbial) slow; careful; gentle; quiet

column2:
pron
  1. (some dialects of Ripuarian, including Kölsch) I; nominative of the first-person singular personal pronoun

proverb
  1. All people are crazy, but in different ways. You may think someone crazy for one thing, but they might think you crazy for another.
  2. to each his own

det
  1. (most of Ripuarian) enough

pron
  1. (most of Ripuarian) enough

adv
  1. (most of Ripuarian) enough

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, dated in some dialects) to happen, occur

adj
  1. (Ripuarian) grey; especially of hair, but also in a general sense

adv
  1. (central and eastern Ripuarian) gladly, with pleasure (expresses English like to)

verb
  1. (chiefly Ripuarian, including Kirchröadsj) to speak; to talk; to chat
  2. (Kirchröadsj, obsolete) to call
  3. (Kirchröadsj, obsolete) to give a name to

det
  1. (most of Ripuarian, western Moselle Franconian) no, not a, not any

verb
  1. (most dialects) to know; to be acquainted with
  2. (Moselle Franconian) can; to be able to / of
  3. (Moselle Franconian) to be possible

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to chat, to talk among each other

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, transitive or intransitive) to stick; to be sticky

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to blink, wink
  2. (Ripuarian, rare) to squeeze, pinch

adj
  1. (Ripuarian, of living beings) mean, evil, wicked
  2. (Ripuarian, of living beings) angry, furious
  3. (Ripuarian, of limbs) sore, hurting
  4. (Ripuarian, only of weather, times) bad, unfavourable
  5. (Ripuarian, of money) false, counterfeit

verb
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) to creep, to crawl

verb
  1. (some Ripuarian dialects, including Kölsch) to come

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, archaic in most areas) to come

adj
  1. (Ripuarian, north-western Moselle Franconian) short; not long

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) can; to be able to / of
  2. (Ripuarian) to be possible

verb
  1. (southern Moselle Franconian) to run; to walk; to go (move on foot, either at a normal or at an increased speed)

column1: leck mich en der Täsch|leck mich en der Täsch!
column2:
intj
  1. (Ripuarian, somewhat vulgar) damn!, wow!, fuck me! (expression of being surprised, impressed, dismayed)

adj
  1. empty; not full
  2. vacant; empty; not occupied (e.g. a seat)
  3. unmarried; single

adj
  1. (central and eastern Ripuarian) light, not heavy
  2. (same dialects) easy, not difficult

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive) to lie; to tell lies
  2. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to lead
  3. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to manage (an orginization)
  4. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to conduct (a liquid, electricity, etc.)
  5. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive) to lead, to go, to follow a path to

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) to lie; to tell lies

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) to lend; to loan
  2. (same regions, usually with reflexive dative) to borrow

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) to learn
  2. (same dialects) to teach

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to lie (be in a horizontal position)
  2. (westernmost Ripuarian) to suffer

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) to walk; to go; to run (move on foot, either at a normal or at an increased speed)

verb
  1. (northernmost Ripuarian) to walk; to go; to run (move on foot, either at a normal or an increased speed)

verb
  1. (most dialects) to let
  2. (most dialects) to make (someone do something)

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to look (originally: look closely, but now also generally)

verb
  1. (most dialects) to put; to lay; to make lie

verb
  1. (transitive) to make, form , produce, create (an object, arrangement, situation, etc.)
  2. (transitive, of food, drinks, etc.) to make, prepare
  3. (transitive, informal) to do
  4. (transitive, with an adjective) to make (to cause to be)
  5. (transitive, arithmetic) to make, be, equal (the result of a calculation)
  6. (transitive, informal, colloquial) to make, earn (to earn, gain wages, profit, etc.)
  7. (transitive, impersonal, colloquial) to matter (to be important)
  8. (intransitive, informal, euphemistic) to do one's business, do number two or number one, go (to defecate or urinate)
  9. (reflexive) to do (to fare or perform (well or poorly))
  10. (with et, 't) to live

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj Ripuarian, transitive) to eat
  2. (Kirchröadsj Ripuarian, intransitive) to eat

det
  1. (many dialects, in the plural) some
  2. (many dialects, in the singular) many a(n)

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to like
  2. (Ripuarian) may; to be conceivable
  3. (Ripuarian, obsolete in many dialects) may; to be allowed to

det
  1. (Ripuarian, in the plural) some
  2. (Ripuarian, in the singular) many a(n)

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, auxiliary) must; to have to; should

adv
  1. (most dialects) no longer; not any more

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, chiefly western dialects) to call (someone something)

abbrev
  1. (most dialects) Contraction of op/of däm (“on the”).
  2. (parts of Eifel) Contraction of on däm (“in the”).

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to smoke a pipe
  2. (Ripuarian) to wheeze (breathe loudly and with trouble)
  3. (Ripuarian) to sulk, be grumpy
  4. (Ripuarian, only in expressions) to whistle or play a wind instrument (but this sense is usual in Moselle Franconian)

adj
  1. (Kirchröadsj) red (colour)
  2. (Kirchröadsj, politics) red; pertaining to Marxism in the widest sense; social democratic; socialist; communist
  3. (Kirchröadsj, possibly mildly offensive) red-haired
  4. (Kirchröadsj, historical, possibly offensive) redskin; Native American; Indian

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) to call; to shout

verb
  1. (most of Ripuarian, northern Moselle Franconian) to smoke

adv
  1. (Ripuarian, parts of western Moselle Franconian) right (not left)

adj
  1. (Ripuarian) still, calm, easy, tranquil, silent (without stress, movement, and/or sound)

adv
  1. (Ripuarian) just, freely, easily (without too much reluctance, caution, or fear); often expresses English may as well

adj
  1. (central and eastern Ripuarian) right (not left)
  2. (central and western Ripuarian) right (as it should be)

adj
  1. (Ripuarian) angry, enraged
  2. (Ripuarian) in heat, randy, horny

verb
  1. (most of Ripuarian) to shine
  2. (same dialects) to seem, appear

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, as a variant) to hit; to beat; to defeat

verb
  1. (most dialects) to hit; to beat; to defeat

verb
  1. (chiefly Ripuarian) to speak, talk
  2. (Ripuarian, now rare) to eat a lot
  3. (Ripuarian, now rare) to slap

verb
  1. (most of Ripuarian) to hover, soar, float, drift

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, Siegerland Moselle Franconian) to be silent, to say nothing

verb
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) to scold; to rebuke; to rail; to complain

adj
  1. having a crooked or limited view: cross-eyed, one-eyed, or squinting
  2. (figuratively) not right; false, crooked
  3. (figuratively) referring to the other bank of the Rhine (now mostly the eastern one)

adj
  1. (many dialects of Ripuarian) beautiful; pretty; nice

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to be
  2. (some dialects of Ripuarian) to see

det
  1. (Ripuarian) his, its (third-person masculine and neuter possessive)

verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to speak (some language, the truth, etc.)
  2. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive, [uvver (about) + accusative], [oes (from)]) to speak, to talk, to give a speech
  3. (Kirchröadsj, transitive) to say, to speak (a word, phrase, sentence, prayer, etc.)
  4. (Kirchröadsj, archaic, reflexive, of a word) to have a pronunciation; to be pronounced (some way)

verb
  1. (most dialects) shall; should; to be supposed to; expressing obligation or hearsay
  2. (most dialects, dated) will; shall; used to form the future tense

verb
  1. (most dialects) to put; to place; to make stand

verb
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian, of animals) to drink
  2. (the same dialects, of people) to drink excessively (usually alcohol)

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to pull, draw
  2. (Ripuarian) to go, march

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to tell
  2. (Ripuarian) to talk; to speak with each other

prep
  1. (Ripuarian) before; prior to
  2. (Ripuarian) in front of

adv
  1. (Ripuarian) up front, at the front
  2. (Ripuarian) over, ahead (at some place lying in front of one)

verb
  1. (most dialects) to grow; to become larger

adj
  1. (some dialects of Ripuarian) far; wide; distant

verb
  1. (Ripuarian, dated in some dialects) to throw; to cast

verb
  1. (most dialects) to know; to be aware (of a fact)

adv
  1. (eastern and central dialects) again; another time; once more

column2:
adj
  1. (Kirchröadsj) white, reflecting most or all light
  2. (Kirchröadsj) white, having a low amount of melanin in an organ, e.g. the skin
  3. (Kirchröadsj, figuratively) legal

adj
  1. (westernmost and northernmost Ripuarian) far; wide; distant

det
  1. (Kirchröadsj) little, few, not much, not many

pron
  1. (Kirchröadsj) little, not much, not a lot

adj
  1. (Kirchröadsj) little, few (a small amount, a small number)

adv
  1. (Kirchröadsj) little, not much
  2. (Kirchröadsj) not often, rarely

column2:
proverb
  1. (Ripuarian) who pays the piper calls the tune

column1: wä de Musik bestellt, dä moss se och bezahle|wä de Musik bestellt|dä moss se och bezahle
column2:
proverb
  1. (Ripuarian) in for a penny, in for a pound

verb
  1. (Ripuarian) to become
  2. (Ripuarian) to be; used with past participles to form the passive voice
  3. (Ripuarian) will; shall; used with infinitives to form the future tense (which is rather rare, however)

column2:
verb
  1. (Kirchröadsj, copulative, with a predicate adjective or predicate nominative) to be
  2. (Kirchröadsj, with a dative object and certain adjectives) to feel, (to experience a condition)
  3. (Kirchröadsj, auxiliary) forms the present perfect and past perfect tense of certain intransitive verbs
  4. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive) to exist; there to be; to be alive
  5. (Kirchröadsj, intransitive, colloquial) to have the next turn (in a game, in a queue, etc.)

column2:
adj
  1. (Kirchröadsj) black, reflecting little or no light
  2. (Kirchröadsj) black, having a high amount of melanin in an organ, e.g. the skin
  3. (Kirchröadsj, figuratively) illegal
  4. (Kirchröadsj, of coffee) without milk

noun
  1. (most dialects of Ripuarian) pea (kind of pulse)

adj
  1. (Ripuarian, chiefly of things, events) bad; tremendous

adv
  1. (Ripuarian) badly; terribly
  2. (Ripuarian) very; much; a lot

adj
  1. (some dialects of Ripuarian) genuine, real, true

prep
  1. (Ripuarian) around

abbrev
  1. (parts of Eifel) Contraction of ön däm (“in the”).

det
  1. (Ripuarian) your (second-person plural possessive)

pron
  1. (much of Ripuarian) you, y'all (second-person plural pronoun)
